intro: Lysionotus sangzhiensis, commonly known as the Sangzhi bellflower, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in mountainous regions and has hairy leaves that help it retain moisture. It is a perennial herb with a compact growth habit and is often found in moist, shaded environments. Lysionotus sangzhiensis is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and limited distribution.
